page.title: 20Ecology.
page.content:
Fishing in Newport is very popular because of all the ponds. Many of the ponds are privately owned and fishing licences are needed to fish the ponds. The main fishing season is from February to about August. The fish to be caught are bream, perch, pike and eels. Just two weeks ago, a ten pound pike was caught in one of the ponds. Apart from these larger fish, there is an abundance of smaller fish and water insects. This good food supply brings coots, grebes, various ducks, swans and geese to the ponds for the enjoyment of the villagers.
This work was compiled by Class 5 of Newport County Primary School, with help from their class teacher Mrs, J. Watt and the head teacher Mrs.E.Walker.
